paper.title: Fischer's protocol revisited: a simple proof using modal constraints
paper.venue: Proceedings of the DIMACS/SYCON workshop on Hybrid systems III : verification and control: verification and control
paper.abstract: As a case study, we apply a constraint-oriented state-based proof methodology to Fischeru0027s protocol. The method exploits compositionality and abstraction to reduce the investigated verification problem. This reduction avoids state space explosion. Key concepts of the reduction process are modal constraints, separation of proof obligations, Skolemization and abstraction. Formal basis for the method are Timed Modal Specifications (TMS) allowing loose state-based specifications, which can be refined by successively adding constraints. TMSu0027s can be easily translated into Modal Timed Automata, thus enabling automatic verification. A central issue of the method is the use of Parametrized TMSu0027s.
